question.title: What is a characteristic of a clinically detectable tophus?
question.description: A type of deposit found in gouty arthritis

option_a.title: It is always located on the wrist

option_b.title: It is typically found on the helix of the ear
option_b.description: A common misconception about tophus location

option_c.title: It is a small, painless bump
option_c.description: A characteristic of a clinically detectable tophus

option_d.title: It is only found in people with rheumatoid arthritis
option_d.description: An incorrect statement about tophus distribution

correct_option.title: C
correct_option.description: The letter corresponding to the correct option
